column4: i've got a few partitions on my computer formatted as the ext3 stuff, i'm not going to have any problems with windows using the data on them am i?
I dont think windows can even read that
any idea what to do then? I've got a heap of data on my ext3 partitions and i'm going back to windows
not dual booting?
no going back to windows completely just too many problems
just problem after problem after problem =(
so i'll just have to move a load of data around and format it as NTFS on ubuntu now before i go back Catoptromancy?
do you have enough free space to move all the files to one partition?
yeah luckily because i slipped and formatted a 400gig the other day lol
bah linux was a pain in the ass right to the end it seems
put all your files on one partiton, and format the empty partiton as FAT32
I would rather suggest using something external, a HD or DVDs
=) that's the plan now
although i'd rather ubuntu just not suck for me lol
or for me to suck at ubuntu?
Linux and windows read FAT32 fine, so all your files wil be on the FAT32
reinstall windows move them to the ntfs and reformat the FAT32 to ntfs, or leave it as FAT32
yeah i'll just do that
farewell #ubuntu, guess i'll come back in a while when i feel like unlimited patience for things like changing my damn harddrive name lol
works great for a dual boot, I access all my files from Windows or Linux, only apps on on the main partition
